quotes.quote: Whatever our souls are made of, his and mine are the same.
No matter how old you both get...  Never stop holding hands, never stop dancing, and never stop saying "I love you."
Many people spend more time in planning the wedding than they do in planning the marriage.
The goal in marriage is not to think alike, but to think together.
What greater thing is there for two human souls than to feel that they are joinedâ€¦ to strengthen each otherâ€¦ to be at one with each other in silent unspeakable memories.
Weddings to me are wondrous because they are so filled with tomorrows.
Now join hands, and with your hands your hearts.
On wedding day you should look like yourself at your most beautiful.
I chose my wife, as she did her wedding gownâ€¦not for a fine glossy surface, but such qualities as would wear well.
After all there is something about a wedding-gown prettier than in any other gown in the world.
When you realize you want to spend the rest of your life with somebody, you want the rest of your life to start as soon as possible.
Weddings remind us that our lives have meaning and that love is the strongest bond, the happiest joy, and the loveliest healing we can ever experience.
We have the greatest pre-nuptial agreement in the world.  It's called love.
Always get married early in the morning. That way, if it doesn't work out, you haven't wasted a whole day.
Happy marriages begin when we marry the ones we love, and they blossom when we love the ones we marry.
Don't marry for money; you can borrow it cheaper.
There is no such cozy combination as man and wife.
All weddings are similar, but every marriage is different.
Two souls, one heart.
Many people spend more time in planning the wedding than they do in planning the marriage.
Weddings are meant to be a celebration of love, but all too often this sentiment gets hijacked by the pressures of delivering a "perfect day."
A wedding is an event. Marriage is a life time. Invest more in your marriage than your wedding and success is inevitable.
Union gives strength.
Love does not consist of gazing at each other, but in looking together in the same direction.

The real act of marriage takes place in the heart, not in the ballroom or church or synagogue. It's a choice you make / not just on your wedding day, but over and over again / and that choice is reflected in the way you treat your husband or wife.
